channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Protest groups hold grand ‘mañanita’
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: Despite warnings from authorities, various groups pushed through yesterday with their Independence Day protest actions – chiefly against the Anti-Terror Bill – but carefully observing physical distancing.

item.title: Ex-DFA chief Yasay, 73
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: Former secretary of the Department of Foreign Affairs Perfecto Yasay Jr. died yesterday due to pneumonia. He was 73.

item.title: ‘Homeschooling an option, but it’s not for all’
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: With the expected suspension of face-to-face classes due to the coronavirus pandemic, the Department of Education has identified homeschooling as a possible option for students to continue with their education.

item.title: It’s official: Rainy season is here The state weather bureau officially declared
item.description: Yesterday the start of the rainy season after Tropical Depression Butchoy dumped heavy rains in many parts of the country over the past days.

item.title: Philippines to get vaccine priority, Xi tells Duterte
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: On the eve of the 122nd anniversary of Philippine Independence Day, Chinese President Xi Jinping called President Duterte to congratulate and assure him that Filipinos would be prioritized in the distribution of a vaccine for coronavirus disease 2019 once it becomes available in China.

item.title: Tax exemptions sought for micro online businesses
item.author: Mary Grace Padin
item.description: Facing the prospect of getting taxed, online sellers may have found an ally in an administration lawmaker who wants the Bureau of Internal Revenue to exempt them and other entrepreneurs earning less than P3 million from value-added tax.

item.title: Duterte to Pinoys: Unite against COVID
item.author: Edith Regalado
item.description: President Duterte urged Filipinos to be united in the battle against the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic and become modern-day heroes, and to display the same bravery that the nation’s heroes showed a century ago in fighting colonizers.

item.title: Anti-terror bill endorsed for signing amid rallies
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: The Anti-Terror Bill of 2020 will pass the constitutional test once it is brought to the Supreme Court, chief presidential legal counsel Salvador Panelo said yesterday.

item.title: DILG chief: Metro Manila likely to remain under GCQ
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: Metro Manila will likely remain under general community quarantine as the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) has not yet been sufficiently contained, Interior Secretary Eduardo Año said yesterday.

item.title: Philippines sees highest single-day COVID-19 recoveries as infections hit 24,787
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: This marks the second, consecutive time that the record was broken this week after 270 survivors were confirmed yesterday.
